title: Radison bringing Blu hotels to Latin America
text:
Radison bringing Blu hotels to Latin America Jul 28, 2015, 7:11am CDT Industries & Tags Mark Reilly Managing Editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Mark Reilly Managing Editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Related Content Nancy Kueh The Radisson Blu Mall of America As Carlson expands its younger-skewing Red concept to the east metro, it's planning growth of its upscale Blu chain much farther south. The Minnetonka-based hospitality company, which yesterday said it planned its second Twin Cities Radisson Red near the Xcel Energy Center in St. Paul, is looking to Latin America as a new market for Radisson Blu , the Star Tribune reports. Carlson is currently planning three Blu hotels in Colombia and Chile, with two of the locations part of upscale resorts. It's also eyeing Brazil, Argentina, Peru and Mexico for future expansions. The company introduced the Blu concept in 2009 and opened the first U.S. property in 2011 in Chicago. It's since opened two others in the Twin Cities and one in Philadelphia.
